requirement_tested: Display real-time weather and air quality data
user_persona: A local resident checking current conditions before going outdoors.
user_goal: To quickly view the current temperature, humidity, and AQI on the homepage.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Maria opens the website to check today's environmental conditions. She expects to see key metrics immediately.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL in browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard loads showing real-time temperature, humidity, pressure, AQI value, and gas sensor readings with icons.

narrative_steps.title: Refreshing Data Manually
narrative_steps.description: Noticing the data might be stale, Maria decides to manually refresh all values to ensure accuracy.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Refresh' button located at the top right corner of the dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All displayed metrics update instantly without a full page reload, and the 'Last Updated' timestamp reflects the new time.

requirement_tested: Show air quality index (AQI) for the past two weeks
user_persona: An environmentally conscious citizen tracking long-term air quality trends.
user_goal: To review how AQI has changed over the past two weeks using a visual chart.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Historical AQI Chart
narrative_steps.description: James scrolls down to find historical data and sees a line graph titled 'Air Quality Over Past Two Weeks'.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the AQI history section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A horizontal line chart appears with dates on X-axis and AQI values on Y-axis, styled in dark slate blue.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Specific Data Points
narrative_steps.description: James wants to know the exact AQI value from five days ago and hovers over that point on the chart.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a data point on the chart.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tooltip displays the precise AQI value and timestamp for that day.

requirement_tested: Allow users to compare pollution and air quality changes over time
user_persona: A researcher analyzing pollutant variations during different seasons.
user_goal: To compare PM2.5 vs PM10 levels and gaseous pollutants over a custom date range.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Comparison Section
narrative_steps.description: Dr. Lee navigates to the pollution comparison area where he finds two side-by-side charts and a date selector.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the pollution comparison tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Two charts load—one for particulate matter and one for gaseous pollutants—with default last-week date range selected.

narrative_steps.title: Customizing Date Range
narrative_steps.description: Wanting to analyze March data, Dr. Lee clicks the date range picker and selects custom start/end dates.
narrative_steps.action: Click the date range selector and choose custom dates.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both charts update dynamically to reflect the newly selected timeframe.

requirement_tested: Provide browsing of current weather data including temperature and humidity
user_persona: A jogger planning her morning workout based on outdoor conditions.
user_goal: To check current temperature and humidity to decide whether it’s safe to exercise outside.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Current Weather Metrics
narrative_steps.description: Lisa looks for quick access to essential weather info and finds a prominent card-based layout.
narrative_steps.action: Look at the main weather panel on the homepage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Large numeric displays show temperature and humidity with accompanying weather icons.

narrative_steps.title: Switching Temperature Units
narrative_steps.description: Preferring Fahrenheit, Lisa toggles the unit switch next to the temperature reading.
narrative_steps.action: Click the unit toggle switch near the temperature display.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Temperature updates to show value in Fahrenheit while humidity remains unchanged.

requirement_tested: Display gas sensor data in real-time
user_persona: A city health official monitoring toxic gas exposure risks.
user_goal: To monitor real-time CO, NO2, O3, and SO2 concentrations from dedicated sensors.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Gas Sensor Readings
narrative_steps.description: Officer Patel visits the gas sensor dashboard expecting up-to-the-minute readings from multiple sensors.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the gas sensor section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Grid of cards appears, each labeled with a specific gas type and displaying its current PPM level and timestamp.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Sensor Metadata
narrative_steps.description: Patel wants to verify the calibration status of the CO sensor by hovering over its card.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over the Carbon Monoxide sensor card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional tooltip shows sensor metadata such as calibration status and measurement accuracy.

requirement_tested: Implement real-time update functionality for all data
user_persona: A news reporter covering a smog event requiring constant updates.
user_goal: To observe automatic data refreshes every minute without needing manual intervention.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Auto Refresh
narrative_steps.description: Reporter Kim leaves the site open to track ongoing air quality changes. She notes the 'Last Updated' label beneath each section.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for 60 seconds after loading the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All data sections auto-refresh, and the 'Last Updated' timestamps increment accordingly.

narrative_steps.title: Manually Triggering Immediate Update
narrative_steps.description: When breaking news hits about a sudden spike, Kim manually forces an instant data pull.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Refresh Now' button next to the timestamp.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All data streams reload immediately, bypassing scheduled intervals.

requirement_tested: Use azure mist as the primary background color
user_persona: A UX designer evaluating visual consistency across platforms.
user_goal: To confirm the site uses azure mist (#F0FFFF) as the global background tone.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Site Background
narrative_steps.description: Designer Alex inspects the homepage visually and checks CSS variables to validate background styling.
narrative_steps.action: Open developer tools and inspect the body element’s computed styles.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Background color is confirmed as #F0FFFF (azure mist) across all viewports.

requirement_tested: Style UI elements with dark slate blue
user_persona: A frontend developer validating UI component styling compliance.
user_goal: To verify that all interactive elements use dark slate blue (#483D8B) consistently.

narrative_steps.title: Validating Button Styling
narrative_steps.description: Developer Sam inspects various buttons and form controls to ensure they match brand guidelines.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect several UI elements like buttons, headers, and input fields using DevTools.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All inspected elements utilize #483D8B for borders, text, or backgrounds with appropriate contrast.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Hover States
narrative_steps.description: Sam tests hover behavior on interactive components to ensure correct styling feedback.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a styled button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Button fill lightens slightly but retains dark slate blue border and shadow effects.

requirement_tested: Fetch all dynamic data from backend APIs
user_persona: A QA engineer verifying data integrity and source authenticity.
user_goal: To ensure no mock or hard-coded data exists in production UI views.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Network Requests
narrative_steps.description: QA tester Jake opens network dev tools to capture API calls made upon initial page load.
narrative_steps.action: Open browser DevTools > Network tab and reload the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Multiple XHR requests are logged fetching real-time weather, AQI, and sensor data from backend endpoints.

requirement_tested: Connect backend to external PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables
user_persona: A DevOps specialist setting up deployment environments securely.
user_goal: To confirm backend connects properly to PostgreSQL using specified environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Database Connection Setup
narrative_steps.description: DevOps lead Morgan reviews configuration files and runtime logs to ensure secure database access.
narrative_steps.action: Check backend `.env` file and server startup logs.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Logs indicate successful connection to PostgreSQL instance using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc.

requirement_tested: Configure package.json with npm run install:all to install frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: A new team member cloning and building the project locally.
user_goal: To easily install all dependencies for both frontend and backend using one command.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Project Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: New hire Taylor clones the repo and runs the standard setup script to get started quickly.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` from the project root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Concurrently installs packages in both frontend/ and backend/ directories successfully.

requirement_tested: Configure package.json with npm run dev to start frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: A developer working on integrated features needing simultaneous service operation.
user_goal: To launch both frontend and backend development servers with a single command.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Developer Jordan begins workday by launching both services together for seamless integration testing.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run dev` from the project root.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend (React/Vue) and backend (Node/Express) servers boot up concurrently in same terminal session.

requirement_tested: Implement API endpoints for serving weather and air quality data
user_persona: A mobile app developer integrating with this platform’s public APIs.
user_goal: To consume well-defined RESTful endpoints delivering structured environmental data.

narrative_steps.title: Consuming Weather Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: App developer Riley sends a GET request to fetch current weather parameters.
narrative_steps.action: Send HTTP GET request to `/api/weather/current`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Receives structured JSON response containing temperature, humidity, pressure, and wind speed.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Historical AQI Data
narrative_steps.description: Riley then retrieves historical AQI records for the past 7 days.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to `/api/aqi/history?days=7`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns ordered list of AQI entries with timestamps and values for plotting.

requirement_tested: Design responsive UI components for data visualization
user_persona: A student accessing the site on a smartphone during class.
user_goal: To interact with all features comfortably despite limited screen space.

narrative_steps.title: Using Mobile Layout
narrative_steps.description: Student Mia accesses the site on her phone and observes layout adjustments for smaller screens.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window or open site on mobile device.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Content rearranges vertically, fonts grow larger, and tap targets expand for better touch interaction.

narrative_steps.title: Zooming Into Charts
narrative_steps.description: While reviewing pollution trends, Mia pinches the chart canvas to focus on a narrow time interval.
narrative_steps.action: Perform pinch-zoom gesture on a chart visualization.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Chart zooms smoothly into selected region, maintaining clarity and interactivity.

requirement_tested: Include date/time stamps for all displayed data points
user_persona: A policy analyst documenting environmental reports with strict timestamping needs.
user_goal: To reference accurate timestamps associated with every data entry presented.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Timestamp Accuracy
narrative_steps.description: Analyst Noah checks that each metric includes a clearly marked and correctly localized timestamp.
narrative_steps.action: Examine footer labels beneath each data block on the dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each section ends with a timestamp in ISO format converted to user's local timezone (e.g., HH:mm:ss).
